meanings.definition: To operate a bicycle by pushing the pedals with the feet.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys pedaling her bike around the park.
meanings.sent2: He was pedaling furiously to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: Pedaling slowly, she made her way up the hill with determination.
meanings.sent4: The team was pedaling together in perfect harmony towards their goal.
meanings.sent5: The sound of pedaling echoed through the quiet street.

meanings.definition: To play a piano or other musical instrument by pressing the pedals.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, she was pedaling the piano gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The musician was pedaling the organ with skill and precision.
meanings.sent3: Pedaling enthusiastically, he added a unique touch to the music.
meanings.sent4: The pianist's foot was pedaling the sustain pedal gently.
meanings.sent5: The sound of pedaling added depth to the musical performance.

meanings.definition: To move by working the pedals of a machine, such as a sewing machine or a bicycle.
meanings.sent1: She was pedaling the sewing machine to stitch the fabric together.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic was pedaling the bicycle repair stand effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: Pedaling the exercise bike, he pretended to race in the Tour de France.
meanings.sent4: The old car was pedaling slowly down the road, its engine struggling.
meanings.sent5: The robot was pedaling the stationary bike to generate electricity for the town.
